subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: The Crucifixion: Death That Launched a Faith
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Crucifixion: Death That Launched a Faith.

hook.text: Romans crucified thousands. It was a routine execution. But this one death changed the world forever.

buildup.text: Jesus was arrested, tried by Pontius Pilate, and crucified around 30 CE. His followers scattered in terror.

discovery.text: Crucifixion was designed to humiliate. A crucified messiah was absurd to Jews and offensive to Romans.

twist.text: Yet Christians turned the cross from a symbol of shame into one of hope. Defeat became victory. Death became life.

climax.text: The crucifix is now the world's most recognized symbol. History's greatest reversal: execution became salvation.

punchline.text: Rome meant the cross as shame. Christians made it the world's symbol of hope.

quiz.question: What was crucifixion meant to symbolize in Roman times?
